title: Cristiana Stancu
text:
Cristiana "Mongol" Stancu (born July 19, 1991) is a Romanian <a href="mixed%20martial%20arts">mixed martial artist</a>, <a href="karate">karate</a>ka, <a href="Amateur%20boxing">boxer</a> and <a href="kickboxing">kickboxer</a>.
Early life.
Cristiana was raised in <a href="Bucharest%2C%20Romania">Bucharest, Romania</a>, born from a professional bowling player (mother) and a jujitsu martial artist (father). She had an early start in both martial arts and painting, her second profession, when her parents observed her talents since she was only three years old. She began her career in combat sports at age 9 while painting in the same complex in the capital, the father of one of her colleagues painting being a martial arts coach. She retired from her Kyokushin karate career after 9 glamorous years, to begin developing in the art of Kempo, and then start her Kickboxing and MMA career, being the first woman in Romania to ever enter a cage and win and international World Title under Igor Vovchanchyn. Later, Cristiana would also pursue her boxing career.
Fighting career.
Kickboxing career.
SUPERKOMBAT Fighting Championship career.
On February 26, 2015 it was announced that will compete in the first ever women's fight in SUPERKOMBAT history, bout scheduled March 7 against <a href="Annalisa%20Bucci">Annalisa Bucci</a> at <a href="SUPERKOMBAT%20World%20Grand%20Prix%20I%202015">SUPERKOMBAT World Grand Prix I 2015</a> in Ploiești, Romania.
Kickboxing record.
! style=background:white colspan=9 | 
Life.
She's specialist in <a href="icon">icon</a>ography. Some of her icons were sold over a thousand euros.
Cristiana took part in several kyokushin and kempo events in Japan, where she met <a href="Ray%20Sefo">Ray Sefo</a>, <a href="Jayson%20Vemoa">Jayson Vemoa</a> or the coaches of <a href="Francisco%20Filho%20%28martial%20artist%29">Francisco Filho</a> and <a href="Glaube%20Feitosa">Glaube Feitosa</a> becoming friends with all and learning from them. Her models are <a href="Benny%20Urquidez">Benny Urquidez</a>, <a href="Chuck%20Norris">Chuck Norris</a>, <a href="Fedor%20Emelianenko">Fedor Emelianenko</a>. <a href="Portugal">Portuguese</a> champion José (Zé) Fortes also educated her on <a href="Muay%20Thai">Muay Thai</a>.
Other.
Along with her spouse, Cristiana has created the Societies Magazine, a cultural magazine in Romania, with a general view over the Romanian society and the foreign societies Romania is interacting.
Also, she is the general editor for <a href="Sport%20Revolution">Sport Revolution</a> Magazine, the best sports magazine in Romania.
Asian Games, Turkmenistan 2017.
Cristiana was a special reporter for the Indoor and Martial Arts Games, held in Ashgabad, Turkmenistan.
She has been invited to speak in different events about her success story both life and sport. Because of her great speaking talent she influences in a positive way many people. Recently, she made her debut in professional speaking on <a href="TEDx">TEDx</a> stage.
-2015 Sports Person in Romania, awarded by <a href="Alexandrion%20Group">Alexandrion Group</a>
-2015 The Person of the Year in Sports, awarded by <a href="Cotidianul">Cotidianul</a>
